posts.post_content: As soon as this was spoiled, I made a proxy deck with [Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone), [Stolen Identity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stolen Identity), etc. I discovered that adding another creature that likes to be copied, such as [Timberpack Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timberpack Wolf), gives the deck another win condition and makes it more consistent.
posts.html:
As soon as this was spoiled, I made a proxy deck with Clone, Stolen Identity, etc. I discovered that adding another creature that likes to be copied, such as Timberpack Wolf, gives the deck another win condition and makes it more consistent.

posts.post_content:
@Taudisbam: Turn 4 win condition which allows you to play 100% defensively up until that point, to boot. No need to damage the opponent. Granted it's a pipedream to get that perfect hand consistently but with the insane hand advantage you can gain in green/blue, it's pretty decent.  
  
A guy at the 2nd pre-release event at my store managed to win with it twice in the 5 rounds because he managed to draw 3 of them in his two packs along with [Stolen Identity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stolen Identity).
posts.html:
@Taudisbam: Turn 4 win condition which allows you to play 100% defensively up until that point, to boot. No need to damage the opponent. Granted it's a pipedream to get that perfect hand consistently but with the insane hand advantage you can gain in green/blue, it's pretty decent.

A guy at the 2nd pre-release event at my store managed to win with it twice in the 5 rounds because he managed to draw 3 of them in his two packs along with Stolen Identity.

Posted By: SRSFACE (1/26/2013 10:59:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Turn 1: Forest, [Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf)  
  
Turn 2: Island, this guy  
  
Turn 3: Island, [Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone)  
  
Turn 4: Any land, [Cackling Counterpart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cackling Counterpart), [Druid's Deliverance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Druid's Deliverance), win.  
  
Turn four win in standard ain't half bad.  
  
Also, in terms of [Stolen Identity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stolen Identity), both this guy and [Elusive Krasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elusive Krasis) curve nicely into [Elgaud Shieldmate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elgaud Shieldmate).
posts.html:
Turn 1: Forest, Arbor Elf

Turn 2: Island, this guy

Turn 3: Island, Clone

Turn 4: Any land, Cackling Counterpart, Druid's Deliverance, win.

Turn four win in standard ain't half bad.

Also, in terms of Stolen Identity, both this guy and Elusive Krasis curve nicely into Elgaud Shieldmate.
